description: The last operating double-decker theatre in the world. Built in 1913 and restored and renovated by the Ontario Heritage Trust in the 1980s today the Elgin & Winter Garden Theatres are home to a diverse and variety of entertainment in Toronto. The downstairs auditorium is the elegant Elgin Theatre red and gold in Edwardian design. The upstairs theatre is the whimsical Winter Garden a unique botanical rooftop garden that blooms year around. Join us for musicals, operas, comedy and films. Public tours happen throughout the year check webpage for specific dates, times and tickets.

reviews.title: Amazing
text: Theatre with different rooms gives you a classic experience when visiting it. Absolutely beautiful place.

reviews.title: I’m glad they didn’t tear it down.
text: This theatre was slated to be torn  down but the community saved it. It was built in the early 1900’s. It has two theaters. One upstairs and one down stairs. It has a lot of character. The old hand operated elevators still work.

We visited during Open Door which is a concept to get people into buildings that they would not have otherwise visited.  We did not see a show here but will gladly do so when convenient. I am glad we got to see this place.

reviews.title: Majestic atmosphere.
text: Majestic atmosphere. The maintenance is not looking very good though. I was expecting a better service. People look pressured and unhappy.

reviews.title: Crazy Show and Exquisite Theater
text: Saw a unique interactive show for kids and adults alike.  Sat in a box seat by the stage which was not much more than the other seats.  Great theater, great show.

reviews.title: Opera Atelier is in fine form
text: We had not been in the Elgin since before the pandemic hit, and it was very enjoyable to get back into this attractive space to attend a performance of Henry Purcell's Dido and Aeneas by Tafelmusik. Fine performances all around!

reviews.title: Iconic institution
text: The Elgin is an iconic institution located in downtown Toronto. It hosts various events from live theatre, music, to film. Visited it to see a TIFF flick and had a great time. Seats are spacious, plenty of leg room. There is a smell of fresh hipster musk and nostalgia upon entering the main theatre. The decor is classic North American urban 20th century grand theatre, similar to the greats in Detroit. Had a great experience and looking forward to going again.

reviews.title: Beautiful theatre. Very friendly and accommodating to Film and Television productions.
text: Just an absolutely amazing theatre! We came to see Come From Away a while back and the show, cast, and performance was astonishing. Hands down the best play I’ve ever seen but I have to mention the two theatres... They’re beautiful works of art, the most unique theatres I’ve ever seen. Once it’s safe to return, you bet I will be!

reviews.title: Beautiful and historical
text: We have often been to the Elgin theatre but this was our first occasion to discover the Winter Garden theatre. It is an incredible location with an amazing decor. Located above the Elgin it is a smaller original venue. Don’t miss the opportunity to visit!

reviews.title: Tours are great
text: They do tours here for $12 and they are well worth it! The tour lasts about 90 minutes and take you through the lobby areas, the orchestra and balconies of both theatres, as well as backstage of the Winter Garden. Even though I had been here before I found the tours very interesting.

reviews.title: Take the 100+years old elevator
text: When I suggested to take a guided tour to the theatre，some of my friends said why dont we leverage a show to visit the theatre rather than investing additional time and money？I have to say it is really worth it！We attended the Saturday morning 10:00 2 hours guided tour. Two volunteers hosted us. Linda let us take the 1913 made Otis Elevator. It is manually operated！They spend two hours to relfect the theatre history and how it was restored including keeping the original spelling mistake. They keep it as Edward time style. It is really amazing to see the only operating double decker theatre in the world on site. I really recommend people pay a visit there. When you know the stories，you will see this theatre differently when you come for a show next time.

reviews.title: Elgin Theatre performance Come From Away
text: Went to the Elgin Theatre to see the performance Come From Away and was very impressed with the seating arrangements “there were no bad seats”. The performance was amazing and the upcoming performances are sure to entice me to come back.

reviews.title: Enjoyment of Come From Away
text: The gorgeous original architecture is fabulous. Even the elevator and doormen put you in a different world. I love this theater for its originality and beauty. The seating is accommodating and the show was magnificent! My Sister and I enjoyed!

reviews.title: Elegant Theatre
text: Saw a TIFF movie here! There are class and elegance as soon as you walk through the doors! We took the elevator all the way to the orchestra level. Seats were comfortable with a great view of the stage. Staff very friendly as well!

reviews.title: Breathtaking building!
text: The architecture and interior design of this theater is absolutely spectacular.  We were in town for a few days and were lucky enough to get tickets to a wonderful musical, Come From Away at the last minute.  Great seats too!  Really isn't a bad seat in the house.

reviews.title: Classy theatre
text: We visited the theatre to watch Come From Away and enjoyed the experience. Leg room in the orchestra section was decent and the ushers guided us so that we could get to our seats without difficulty. Acoustics are also excellent

reviews.title: Amazing beautiful theatre, wonderful staff
text: Visiting from UK and came to see Come From Away. Every member of staff we encountered was friendly, helpful, smiling and happy to assist. What a lovely experience. The theatre is stunning and has such character. The seating is comfortable and spacious. The show itself was excellent.

reviews.title: Superb old theatre and a fantastic show
text: We had a great night watching Come From Away. The experience from start to finish was excellent. We had booked tickets from the UK before we arrived and picked them up on the day.
The staff made us very welcome and handed out programmes on arrival. The theatre itself was amazing and the decorations within the theatre were great to look at.

The show itself was brilliant. The quality of the cast and the music was outstanding. I would thoroughly recommend seeing it. I wanted to see the show in its native country and it was such a feel good experience.
The seating was comfortable and spacious which is unusual in an older theatre.

reviews.title: Best seating of any theatre
text: We love the Elgin as there is actually leg room between the rows and the seats are very comfortable. When you're watching a show for several hours seating is a factor, :) Parking was very easy across the road at the Eaton Centre. We also found that going to a matinee performance saves on the hideous traffic going in & out of the city.

reviews.title: Come From Away
text: Goods story line, poor props and poor choreography. The theatre seats are most uncomfortable. and getting there is a problem.

reviews.title: Saw "Come From Away"
text: We drove to Toronto to celebrate my husband's birthday, and wanted to be sure to catch a show while we were there. We were in Row K, which was just under the balcony on the first level. My husband is tall, so he was a bit cramped for legroom. A guy as tall as him sat in front of me and blocked the entire center of the stage, so my husband switched seats with me. He has hearing aids, so we stopped at the concession stand that provided hearing assist devices, which he has used in other theaters with success.

What he didn't tell me until the end of the play was, because he had to remove his hearing aids to use the device, he could not pick up any of the high pitched voices (basically all the women in the play). I was so sad to hear he had missed out on so much of the dialogue. He didn't want to disturb me to get his hearing aids, which were in my purse, because he wasn't sure if he would be able to understand any of the dialogue if he had them in anyway. There was no intermission, so he basically just tried to pick up as much of the story as he could with only hearing part of it.

In using a similar device at Centennial Hall in Tucson, AZ, he was able to hear the dialogue and singing very clearly. It's a shame that we have to pay to see the play again at another location if he wants to really take it all in as intended. They should work on finding a better option for people with hearing loss!
Other than that, this a a beautiful theater and the ushers were very helpful.

reviews.title: Anastasia at the Elgin
text: We attended a recent performance of Anastasia at the Elgin, a total feast for the eyes! The inside of the theatre lavish costumes and sets but most of all the songs! The cast was stellar a true chorus of angels singing on the stage!
It was a great show, highly recommended so try and catch it before it leaves town!

reviews.title: Elegant Theatre in The Heart of Toronto
text: The landmark theatre complex of The Elgin & winter Garden Theatre on Yonge Street hosts a variety of live performances and most recently Come From Away.
There are guided tours of this National Historic Site and the last operating double-decker theatre in the world.  The Tour Guides recount the history and restoration of the complex.
When you enter you are transported back in time the original and new lobbies, the elegant Elgin Theatre, the unique and whimsical Winter Garden Theatre.
It is a must see treasure and enjoy a play or concert while you are there too!

reviews.title: Nice evening
text: Went to watch a comedy show with co-workers. It was a great show and had a lot of fun. nice seats and sound.

reviews.title: Try for RUSH tickets
text: All of the Mirvish theaters in Toronto offer Broadway shows and if you're lucky you can get a RUSH ticket on the day of the show. Go to their website at 9 am or the box office when they open and see what's available for $39. Good luck! you can't go wrong.

reviews.title: Canadian history
text: Come from away was fantastic the story actors everything was exceptional highly recommend true story brought ro life in a wonderful way made us proud to be Canadian

reviews.title: Amazing venue for watching broadway shows
text: We saw our first show in Toronto here, and were thoroughly impressed with Theatre itself and the very attentive staff. Everyone was very kind and helpful, and made our first visit very enjoyable.
The layout of the place makes it tough to have a bad seat in the house. The balcony seats are the best, I think.
If you get the opportunity to see a show here, you should definitely seize it! Can’t wait until we see another performance here! Worth every penny!

reviews.title: Great Theatre
text: We love the location and the people that works there were very friendly and helpfull. If you get a chance to see a production do not second guess it go and enjoy yourself.

reviews.title: First time here
text: Nice size theatre, works well for the play, Come From Away. Seats are comfortable there doesn't appear to be a bad seat in the house for viewing the stage. The only downer was the theatre was quite cool temperature wise. Would come again and recommend to others.

reviews.title: Uplifting Experience
text: Excellent architectural theatre only to be outshone by the Come From Away Performance by amazing cast.

reviews.title: Lovely Old Theater
text: I saw Come From Away in June, 2019 here. I am a frequent theater goer, but had not been to this theater until that performance. It really is very lovely. Now since I have not been here for other performances, I am not sure if the stage is just different than other theaters, or whether it was something different for the Come From Away performance that had been done to the stage. I was in the second row, which I have been at other theaters with no issues of obstructed viewing of the stage.

The front of the stage seemed higher than normal and most people in the front two rows, me included, were given these extra cushions to place in the seats like a booster chair. I have never in my life ever seen such a thing, and while they were not terrible, then the arm rests became too low since you were sitting a few inches higher than normal.

It was really bizarre actually and if I ever go to this theater again, I will never pick so close of a seat. When you were sitting you couldn't see the actors feet. I'm not sure how to describe it, and I do not know if it's always this way here, or just for that particular production if they did something to the stage to make it extend more or something, but when I'm paying nearly $200 for a ticket, I shouldn't need to have to sit on some booster seat!

reviews.title: beautiful venue
text: first time visit to see caroline or change. the show was just ok but the venue was amazing. we sat in the cheapest seats in the 2nd loge and they were a great value

reviews.title: Fantastic old Theatres, with vertigo inducing upper seats
text: You get a real sense of old-style theatre houses. Nice woodwork, brass brightwork, chandeliers...atmosphere.
I found the seats a bit tight, but I'm over 6' tall. And the upper balconies are quite steeply raked which might be a little uncomfortable for those who easily feel vertigo.

reviews.title: Come from Away
text: Fantastic show in a beautiful historic theatre. It was my daughters first time seeing a musical and she loved it. The only negative of our experience was an older couple with the isle seats in our row. They wouldn't move to allow us to get to our seats (Orchestra B seats 27 and 28 - centre stage) they even had the nerve to say to us "this isn't your row" without even knowing what seats we had booked. I guess our business casual attire for a Sunday Matinee led them to believe we couldn't afford the best seats in the theatre ...

reviews.title: Nice Theatre
text: We saw Caroline or Change at the Winter Garden Theatre the other night.  It is an old theatre and has lots of potential, but it needs a major touch-up!  They show was great, we really enjoyed it.

reviews.title: The magic of beautiful architecture and interior design.
text: Recently saw Caroline and change.  The winter garden is a magical place.  Seats were accommodating and comfortable.  You feel like a nymph is a Shakespearean play sitting below the canopy of trees and leaves.

reviews.title: Touch a history
text: Both theatres are cosy and convenient. You can enjoy not only a performance but touch a true history of the city.

reviews.title: Beautiful Theatre
text: Went to see Abbamania.  Had box seats and felt like royalty!  The theatre has old world charm and is small enough that each seat is good.

reviews.title: Come From Away....what a show!
text: I've heard so much about this show and it lived up to our expectations. We saw it several months ago, but I noticed that I hadn't completed this review. Come From Away is a story that we are all familiar with, but the presentation was superb. From the simplicity (yet effectiveness) of the sets, to the music, the theme and the story telling, there was never a dull moment. I believe that it's moved to another location, so find it and go see it. Two thumbs up here!

reviews.title: Gorgeous Venue
text: Beautiful theatre; small, which means all seats are essentially good ones.  We saw Come From Away and it was beyond phenomenal.

reviews.title: Splendid venue for opera
text: Opera Atelier, one of my favourite Canadian opera companies, performs at The Elgin all the time. This theatre is imbued with lovely, decandent retro stylings (art deco?) with a beautifully intimate atmosphere, comfortable seating (both orchestra and balcony) and the accoustics are quite fine. I quite like the intimacy of this well renowned Toronto performance venue. So you're in luck if a show you're looking to watch happens to be playing here.
